intro: Porpax sikkimensis, commonly known as the Sikkim porpax, is a flowering plant native to the Eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Porpax sikkimensis is typically found in moist, shaded habitats at higher elevations.
